data.title: Great Lunch Spot
data.text: GTPC has great food and desserts!  I have eaten at both Lansing area locations and both are consistently great. Cherry chicken salad is so yummy. Mixed berry pie and their chocolate chip cookies are hard to say no to as well!!

data.title: Great breakfast and dessert
data.text:
I had the good fortune of finding this place for breakfast while in Lansing. The quiche was fabulous and it was served with a slice of sweet bread. I also had the cherry coffee which was amazing. I bought a slice of their pie with strawberries, raspberries, blackberries and apple and it was one of the best pies I have ever eaten. Luckily I was told that they ship them so I am sure this won't be my last experience!

The employees were all very friendly and extremely helpful.

data.title: Great Food and Prices
data.text: Went by for breakfast and coffee. Food was fantastic and prices were perfect. Service was even better, staff was attentive and paid close attention to detail. It was very clean and well organized. Highly recommend to anyone.

data.title: Best Quiche
data.text: I knew their pies were good, but this was the first time I had the chance to try their quiche. Delicious. My friend ordered the pastie and was not disappointed. Nice atmosphere and very friendly staff.

data.title: Great breakfast
data.text: I had the Mediterranean quiche here & the MI cherry coffee; it was the best fast breakfast I have ever had.  My husband got the French dip & enjoyed that too.  Cute local place to have breakfast or lunch.

data.title: Delicious lunch
data.text: Stopped in for a delicious, light and satisfying quiche for lunch. Nice selection of pie flavors, enjoyed a slice of cherry crumb later. Worth a stop while you're strolling in the area hunting Pokemon or sight seeing. :)

data.title: Good lunch stop with decent food
data.text:
I stopped here for lunch, and was pleased with the overall quality of the meal.  Beware at this location, though, as there can be a very long wait and line during prime lunch time!  I arrived here at about 11:55 on a Wednesday morning, and took about 20 minutes to wait in line, order and get served.  No fault of the staff, it was very busy!  Which also meant that it was hard to find a place to sit...

I appreciated the variety of food available, and the Michigan ingredients used in several of the salads and sandwiches.  I ordered the Michigan Cherry Chicken Salad, which was very good;  I would have liked more chicken, but the meat that was on the salad was cooked very well, tender, and all in all the salad very tasty and enjoyable.  Many of the other options looked great (including the pies, of course!!).  I also got a coffee to go, which was definitely very tasty as well.

All in all, not a bad coffee or lunch spot - just be ready for very long lines during prime lunch time!

data.title: Like Panera, but BETTER!
data.text:
After my visit to the State Capitol, I was walking around downtown Lansing when I came across this place. I am so glad that I decided to have lunch here. I had a delicious slice of Quiche Lorraine and an equally delicious cherry oatmeal cookie. 

If I lived here, I would come here all of the time!

data.title: More Than Pies
data.text: Great food choices from quiche to three fruit crumble. Blueberry crumble is delicious. They serve blueberry applesauce with their sandwiches. Turkey sandwich is outstanding. Everything is fresh and handmade on the spot. Prompt and friendly customer service. Open, spacious seating.

data.title: Always great
data.text: Enjoy the original in traverse city Mich so had to try this one to compare. Excellent turkey sandwich and the cherry crumb pie aka mode is out of this world. A+

data.title: Best PIES!
data.text: stopped here for lunch, great place with some incredible home-made pies, lunch was very good as well

data.title: Yummmmm
data.text: Don't let the name of the cafe fool you...they do not just sell pies. We stopped in one day just for a slice of pie, and wound up going back two days later for lunch. The first time we ate here we tried the mountain berry and the blue berry pie. Both were excellent, and after we saw the menu, we decided to come back again. The next visit we stopped in for lunch. We had the grilled cheese with tomato soup, and my husband had the pot pie. Both of them were amazing. of course we had to finish with another pie, this time apple crumb. Again, we were not disappointed. we recommended this place to our family living nearby, and they have since become regulars.

data.title: Grand Traverse pies are the best.
data.text:
We love Grand Traverse pie company.The pies are so tasty & good. I love their cornish pasties filled with beef, potatos & veggies.They also have sandwiches,salads,soups,dessert bars,cookies & different baked goods.We love their quiche & pot pies. They have a nice pastry crust & tasty fillings.
We also like to support them because they donate their pies & muffins to the poor & homeless.However their food is so good anyway its always a pleasure to support them

data.title: Go For Lunch BUT Stay For The Pie!
data.text:
Yes, I know it is a local chain but the pie is made onsite. The food is on par with Panera but is tastier / better.
The pie was better than any deserts at Panera. Tables were clean and service was better than average.
The cost is the same as Panera. Street parking on two sides of the restaurant. Parking deck a block away.

data.title: The pies are amazing, but so is there food!
data.text: I stopped to check out there pies and ended up getting lunch and then a slice of pie.  The "ABC" (apple, blueberry, cherry) is delicious as weird as it may sound.  I have also had the Key Lime pie and it is great!  The quiche and chicken bacon ranch sandwich was great also.  Great service!

data.title: Amazing pies - as the name implies
data.text: A nice place for lunch, near the capitol.  Turkey sandwich was good, though nothing special.  But the pie!!!  We got a piece of blueberry crumb to split - WOW!  I don't even like blueberries but this was delicious.  I wish I could have tried more of the flavors.

data.title: Consistently Good, and Fast
data.text: My work frequently takes me to this area in Lansing, and GTPC has become my go-to place for breakfast and lunch. Often busy, but the line always moves quickly. Good food and coffee, and nice outdoor seating if the weather cooperates. There is a syndicated radio show that broadcasts from an adjoining room, and it's fun to watch that.

data.title: Good for Downtown Dining.
data.text: Our party of five ended up here as a compromise between two nearby eateries and, for the most part, we enjoyed our meals.  I wound up with the salad version of the wrap I ordered, but I went ahead and ate it anyway.  It was tasty.  I thought it was cute how they served it in a pie plate.  I'm pretty sure they also got another member of my party's order wrong.  But, all in all, we had a good time and good food here.

data.title: Pie!
data.text: Yes it is a chain but the pie is made onsite.  The food is on par with Panera but is tastier.  Open for lunch and dinner.  Pies by the slice as well as whole for later.

data.title: Very Good Pie!
data.text: Got a slice of chocolate cream and it was one of the best slices of pie I've had! Good amount of pie for the price, too. Definitely will return!
